intro: Acisanthera fluitans, commonly known as the floating beauty, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its buoyant, oval-shaped leaves that allow it to float on the surface of freshwater bodies. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Its roots are adapted to absorb nutrients from the water, making it a common aquatic plant in ponds and lakes. Acisanthera fluitans plays a role in water purification and provides habitat for various aquatic organisms.
